intro: Stachys armena, commonly known as Armenian betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, producing small, tubular blooms in shades of violet or blue. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
